>> Iint = integral(@(z) 200*z/(5+z)*exp(-2*z/30),0,30)

doc.stem:
The heat required, ΔH (cal), to induce a temperature change, ΔT (°C), of a material can be computed as

 

%media:formula19.mml%

 

where m = mass (g) and Cp(T) = heat capacity [cal/(g .°C)]. The heat capacity increases with temperature, T (°C), according to the following equation:

 

%media:formula20.mml%

 

Write a script that uses the integral function to generate a plot of ΔH versus ΔT for cases where m = 1 kg, the starting temperature is −100 °C, and ΔT ranges from 0 to 300 °C.

sectionBreak.stem:
The velocity of a free-falling bungee jumper can be computed analytically as follows:

 

%media:formula49.mml%

 

where v(t) = velocity (m/s), t = time (s), g = 9.81 m/s2, m = mass (kg), and cd = drag coefficient (kg/m).

internal_category.title: ABET Outcomes: (a) an ability to apply knowledge of mathematics, science, and engineering

property.name: problemSolution
property.value: The distance traveled by the jumper during the first 8 seconds of free fall is 255.26003 m.

hint.name: hint #1
hint.value: Use the trapezoidal rule and then apply Romberg integration.

worksheet.stem:
Use Romberg integration to compute the distance traveled by the jumper during the first 8 seconds of free fall. Given, m = 80 kg and cd =0.2 kg/m. Compute the answer to εs = 1%. (Round the final answer to five decimal places.)

 

The distance traveled by the jumper during the first 8 seconds of free fall is __a__ m.
worksheet.commonFeedback:
Using Romberg integration:

 

  1 2 3 4 5
n εa→ 4.2665 0.0316 0.0001124 0.000
1 212.75103 256.53098 255.24166 255.26002 255.26003
2 245.58600 255.32225 255.25974 255.26003  
4 252.88818 255.26364 255.26003    
8 254.66978 255.26025      
16 255.11263

internal_category.title: ABET Outcomes: (a) an ability to apply knowledge of mathematics, science, and engineering

property.name: problemSolution
property.value: The distance traveled be the jumper during the first 8 seconds of free fall is 255.26003 m.

hint.name: hint #1
hint.value: What is the syntax of the MATLAB function integral?

worksheet.stem:
Use the MATLAB integral function to compute the distance traveled by the jumper during the first 8 seconds of free fall. Given, m = 80 kg and cd = 0.2 kg/m. Compute the answer to εs = 1%. (Round the final answer to five decimal places.)

 

The distance traveled by the jumper during the first 8 seconds of free fall is __a__ m.
worksheet.commonFeedback:
Script

 

clear,clc
format long g
g=9.81;m=80;cd=0.2;
v=@(t) sqrt(g*m/cd)*tanh(sqrt(g*cd/m)*t);
y=integral(v,0,8)

y =
          255.260030099128

internal_category.title: ABET Outcomes: (a) an ability to apply knowledge of mathematics, science, and engineering

property.name: problemSolution
property.value: The average flow is estimated to be 4.25289 m<sup>3</sup>/s.

hint.name: hint #1
hint.value: What is the syntax of the MATLAB function spline?

worksheet.stem:
The average flow in a river channel, Q (m3/s), with an irregular cross-section can be computed as the integral of the product of velocity and depth.

 

%media:formula21.mml%

 

where U(y) = water velocity (m/s) at distance y (m) from the bank, and H(y) = water depth (m/s) at distance y from the bank.

Use integral along with spline fits of U and H to the following data collected at different distances across the channel to estimate the flow. (Round the final answer to five decimal places.)

 

y (m) H (m) Y (m)

U (m/s)
0 0 0 0
1.1 0.21 1.6 0.08
2.8 0.78 4.1 0.61
4.6 1.87 4.8 0.68
6 1.44 6.1 0.55
8.1 1.28 6.8 0.42
9 0.2 9 0

 

The average flow is estimated to be __A__ m3/s.
worksheet.commonFeedback:
Function

 

function fx = SplineQuad(x)
yH=[0 1.1 2.8 4.6 6 8.1 9];
H=[0 0.21 0.78 1.87 1.44 1.28 0.2];
yU=[0 1.6 4.1 4.8 6.1 6.8 9];
U=[0 0.08 0.61 0.68 0.55 0.42 0];
fx=spline(yH,H,x).*spline(yU,U,x);

 

Script

 

clear,clc
format long g, format compact
Q=integral(@SplineQuad,0,9)

Q =
          4.25288553276883

property.name: problemSolution
property.value: Computed value of the integral is 64.18432.

hint.name: hint #1
hint.value: What is the syntax of the MATLAB function Monte Carlo integration?

worksheet.stem:
Evaluate the given integral using Monte Carlo integration. (Round the final answer to five decimal places.)

 

Computed value of the integral is __a__.
worksheet.commonFeedback:
Function

 

function Q = MonteCarloQuad(func,n,a,b)
xx=linspace(a,b,1e3);
ff=func(xx);
fmin=floor(min(ff));fmax=ceil(max(ff));
TotalArea=(fmax-fmin)*(b-a);
count = 0; % Number of n that are between function and axis.
hold on
for i = 1:n
  x=a+(b-a)*rand(1); y=fmin+(fmax-fmin)*rand(1);
  fff=func(x);
  if fff>=0
    if y<fff & y>=0
      count = count + 1;
      plot(x,y,'or','MarkerFaceColor','r','MarkerSize',4)
    end
  else
    if y>fff & y<=0
      count = count - 1;
      plot(x,y,'og','MarkerFaceColor','g','MarkerSize',4)
    end
  end
end
hold off
Q = count/n*TotalArea;

 

Script

 

clear,clc,clf,format compact
points = 1e6;
f = @(x) x.^3;
Q = MonteCarloQuad(f,points,0,4);
fprintf('Computed value of integral is %8.7f.\n',Q);

Computed value of integral is 64.1843200.

 

%media:20.030.1.jpg%

internal_category.title: ABET Outcomes: (a) an ability to apply knowledge of mathematics, science, and engineering

internal_category.title: ABET Outcomes: (a) an ability to apply knowledge of mathematics, science, and engineering

property.name: problemSolution
property.value: Computed value of the integral is 29.32704.

hint.name: hint #1
hint.value: What are the arguments required to write a Monte Carlo integration function?

worksheet.stem:
Determine the integral over the interval with Monte Carlo integration. (Round the final answer to five decimal places.)

 

Computed value of the integral is __a__.
worksheet.commonFeedback:
Function

 

function Q = MonteCarloQuad(func,n,a,b)
xx=linspace(a,b,1e3);
ff=func(xx);
fmin=floor(min(ff));fmax=ceil(max(ff));
TotalArea=(fmax-fmin)*(b-a);
count = 0; % Number of n that are between function and axis.
hold on
for i = 1:n
  x=a+(b-a)*rand(1); y=fmin+(fmax-fmin)*rand(1);
  fff=func(x);
  if fff>=0
    if y<fff & y>=0
      count = count + 1;
      plot(x,y,'or','MarkerFaceColor','r','MarkerSize',4)
    end
  else
    if y>fff & y<=0
      count = count - 1;
      plot(x,y,'og','MarkerFaceColor','g','MarkerSize',4)
    end
  end
end
hold off
Q = count/n*TotalArea;

 

Script

 

clear,clc,clf,format compact
points = 1e5;
Q = MonteCarloQuad(@humps,points,0,2);
fprintf('Computed value of integral is %8.7f.\n',Q);

Computed value of integral is 29.32704.

 

%media:20.031.jpg%

%media:formula58.mml%

hint.name: hint #1
hint.value: What is the syntax of the MATLAB function integral2?

worksheet.stem:
Use the results obtained in the previous question of the same section with the integral2 function. (Round the final answer to four decimal places.)

 

The solution is __a__.
worksheet.commonFeedback:
Script:

 

clear,clc,format compact
Q = integral2(@(x,y) y.^4.*(x.^2+x.*y),-3,1,0,2)

Q =
   17.0667
